syllabus_info.title: Cambridge International AS & A Level Mathematics

learning_objectives.description: understand the concept of a continuous random variable, and recall and use properties of a probability density function
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: For density functions defined over a single interval only; the domain may be infinite, e.g. 3/x⁴ for x ≥ 1.

learning_objectives.description: use a probability density function to solve problems involving probabilities, and to calculate the mean and variance of a distribution.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Including location of the median or other percentiles of a distribution by direct consideration of an area using the density function. Explicit knowledge of the cumulative distribution function is not included.
